title: Problem-Based Learning Approach to Mathematics Problem-Solving Instructional Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and basic awareness of teaching experience
context.additional_context: Requires flexible learning design and peer-supported learning systems tailored to non-degree-seeking adult learners' characteristics.

learning_goals: Learners can design math problem-solving lessons by applying the Problem-Based Learning (PBL) model
Learners can develop five or more open-ended math problems that promote student-centered inquiry processes
Learners can analyze learners' thinking and strategies during problem-solving processes using formative assessment tools
Learners can apply feedback strategies that enhance students' self-regulated learning abilities in collaborative problem-solving environments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
